summary: An email from an Assistant United States Attorney in the Southern District of New York regarding the status of image and video files extracted from Jeffrey Epstein's devices. The email notes that folders for one device (NYCO24342) are empty and inquires about missing files from several other devices.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: Author of the email inquiring about image and video files from Epstein devices, specifically noting one device's folders are empty and listing others still awaited.

events.title: Email inquiry about Epstein device files
events.description: An Assistant United States Attorney emails to follow up on image and video files extracted from Jeffrey Epstein's devices, noting one device's folders are empty and listing several others from which files are still awaited.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: The email is dated October 16, 2020, indicating ongoing investigation into Epstein's devices years after his death.
Device NYCO24342 is reported to have empty folders for images and videos, raising questions about data extraction or device content.

Multiple other devices (NYCO24328, NYCO24329, NYCO24353, NYCO24365, NYCO24366, NYCO24371, NYCO24383) are listed as still awaiting image and video files, suggesting a large-scale digital evidence collection effort.
The correspondence involves an Assistant United States Attorney, highlighting federal prosecution involvement in the Epstein case.
